TITLE: Black astronaut says lunar mission will be 'major accomplishment' in American history
SUMMARY: Victor Glover is part of a four-member crew that will orbit the moon in NASA’s Artemis II mission, scheduled for November 2024

TITLE: In the Amazon, Brazilian ecologists try new approach against deforestation and poverty
SUMMARY: The goal is ambitious — counter the forces that have destroyed 10% of the forest in less than four decades and create something that can be replicated in other parts of the Amazon

TITLE: Extreme weather has killed 2 million people over past half century, U.N. says
SUMMARY: The World Meteorological Organization tallied nearly 12,000 extreme weather, climate and water-related events over the past half-century that caused economic damage of $4.3 trillion

TITLE: Three states agree to reduce water usage so the Colorado River doesn't go dry
SUMMARY: A new plan would conserve at least 3 million acre-feet of water by 2026 in an effort to ensure the crucial waterway continues to generate power and provide drinking water

TITLE: NASA has sights set on Mars with help from a nuclear rocket engine
SUMMARY: A conventional spacecraft powered by burning liquid fuel typically takes around seven or eight months to reach the red planet. Scientists have said nuclear rocket engines could shave off at least a third of that time

TITLE: San Francisco's Coit Tower, Twitter HQ and thousands of other buildings may be at risk of a severe quake
SUMMARY: A draft list of San Francisco concrete buildings reveals properties that the city says could be vulnerable to earthquakes and may need costly upgrades

TITLE: Scientists are puzzled by Orcas sinking boats in a string of abnormal attacks
SUMMARY: A string of incidents since 2020 prompted one scientist to say the attacks may indicate that the whales are intending to cause damage to sailing vessels. Others are more skeptical

TITLE: Multivitamins may help slow loss of memory as people get older
SUMMARY: Those who took a daily Centrum Silver pill over a period of three years had better memories than those who received a placebo treatment, new research found

TITLE: Military must focus on short- and long-term challenges of climate change, report finds
SUMMARY: A Rand Corp. study maps out the various ways climate change will impact the military's personnel, equipment, facilities, supply chain and ability to engage with allies and partners

TITLE: Dust storms have killed hundreds and are a growing problem in parts of the U.S.
SUMMARY: Fast-moving winds can suddenly whip dirt and debris into the air, leading to fatal accidents. It's an issue worsened by drought, climate change and land management
